text:
Markus, we have just barely started looking at 23H2, and I’ll admit don’t use
WSUS, however, some of my notes from prior versions: 
- MS has varied the time a feature update is detected…in the distant past it
used to be immediately; in more recent versions of 10 it was towards the end of
the support window (minus 2-3 months). 
- (we had targeting set by the time 11 came out so I don’t know
if 11 was the same) 
- MS will hold detection if there is a known incompatibility with the PC’s
hardware. 
- MS may gradually roll out new versions. 
- if a PC is missing an update it may not see the feature update. 
- I just saw this on 11 where the November CU was installed but “KB4023057:
Update Health Tools—Windows Update Service components” was missing. 
- if 11 Home has a target version set it will not see the targeted feature
update. 
---- 
Steve Yates
ITS, Inc.
%40SN6PR08MB5517.namprd08.prod.outlook.com
